snippet: The state comptroller’s office said the medical center was hemorrhaging millions of dollars every week; it also criticized high administrative salaries.
abstract: New York State comptroller's audit shows that as SUNY Downstate Medical Center was hemorrhaging millions of dollars weekly, 15 of the hospital's top administrators were paid taxpayer-financed salaries over $200,000; at same time, nearly 500 lower-paid employees were sent layoff notices.
lead_paragraph: The state comptroller’s office said the medical center was hemorrhaging millions of dollars every week; it also criticized high administrative salaries.

headline.seo: Audit Finds SUNY Downstate in Dire Fiscal Straits
